description: Mr. Honan was a culture editor for The New York Times and the author of several books.
title: William H. Honan, Journalist and Author, Dies at 83
title_page: William H. Honan, Journalist and Author, Dies at 83 - The New York Times
text:
William H. Honan, an author and journalist who directed coverage of the arts at The New York Times as its culture editor in the 1980s, died on Monday in Norwalk, Conn. He was 83.
His death, at Norwalk Hospital, was caused by cardiac arrest, his wife, Nancy Burton, said. Mr. Honan lived in Redding, Conn.
When he started at The Times in 1969, Mr. Honan had been an associate editor at Newsweek, an assistant editor at The New Yorker and the editor of The Villager, a weekly newspaper serving downtown Manhattan.
He joined The Times as an editor of The New York Times Magazine and became travel editor in 1970. He left the paper in 1972 to be the managing editor of Saturday Review magazine and returned the next year, resuming his role as travel editor.
